medium: Cotton, silk; supplementary weft patterning, embroidery
title: Saint's Huipil
text: Small figurines of the saints and other religious figures are used on altars and in ceremonial processions. In Guatemala, each Catholic church has one or more <I>cofrad√≠a<I>, or religious brotherhood, that is responsible for caring for the figures and for obtaining small garments to clothe them. In many villages, the task of weaving the saints' clothing is given to the most accomplished weaver and carries a great deal of honor and prestige.
description: Single panel; white ground with cotton and silk patterning in purple, pink, magenta and green; large band of geometric patterns and chevrons at shoulders; red and white stripe down center; round cut, embroidered neckline with ties; embroidered words at center of front.
creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
